means: 同伙，合谋者，同党( confederate的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: For seventy miles and twenty - five days the Confederates had fought almost daily.
sentence.Network_cn: 南部联盟军在25天内后退了70英里,几乎每天都在作战.

sentence.Network_en: Would the Confederates march away without even a fight?
sentence.Network_cn: 联盟军会不经过战斗就开走 吗 ?

sentence.Network_en: Hitherto I had had no confederates nor any acquaintance among that tribe.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一向没有同党,同那伙人全不认得.

PerfectNetExp.abs: or else the confederates would rise up out of marshall cemetery and get me ., 不然南方军就会从墓地里复活来抓我.
confederate 同伙, confederates 助试, confederate 帮凶

entry.def: Someone's confederates are the people they are working with in a secret activity.

auth_sentence.content: In one study, a group of three people was set up, where two of the people were confederates of the experimenter.
auth_sentence.res_content: In one study, a group of three people was set up, where two of the people were confederates of the experimenter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In one study, a group of three people was set up, where two of the people were confederates of the experimenter.

auth_sentence.content: When the confederates deliberately gave wrong answers, people were often swayed to give the wrong answer also.
auth_sentence.res_content: When the confederates deliberately gave wrong answers, people were often swayed to give the wrong answer also.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When the confederates deliberately gave wrong answers, people were often swayed to give the wrong answer also.

auth_sentence.content: The five confederates answer first and their decisions are heard by the subject, who answers last.
